author: former grailed admin
text: This platform is corrupt & the admins are thirsty for power. Without question Grailed has the actual worst customer service I have ever encountered; combining this with the recent x2 increase in fees and the way they have consistently ignored their user-base has been a major factor in my move. They alienated a once vital seller-base which has resulted in only a handful of decent sellers with worthwhile items remaining. For a superior alternative I wholly recommend Jawnflip.

author: Yulia
text: This selling platform is very odd. I tried to list a few items (authentic Chanel accessories) and all of them were removed with the reason given "inauthentic replica". Seriously? I've been selling for ages with a long track record on Vestiaire Collective, for example, where all listings are pre-moderated and physically inspected after the items are sold. Never ever even one of them was found to be inauthentic, not even mentioning the fact that a few of my items I tried to list for sale on Grailed had original receipts. Having said that, I seriously doubt the professionalism of those who moderate the website. Shall there be an issue between the buyer and seller - how are they going to determine what is not a replica? Would there be any seller protection or it is going to be something like eBay - non existent? I guess it will be an automatic rip off of the seller - no item and no money given the level of expertise. Unbelievable.
title: Doubt their professionalism and seller protection
